Protect a Convertible
As a convertible owner , you relish the time spent driving with the top down .
You may even brave the road on those cooler days , or live in a climate that has hard winters that may eventually put wear on your convertible top .
Whether it 's hot or cold outside , it 's important to protect your convertible from the elements , and there are several ways to achieve this .
Begin with proper maintenance , which is the key to keeping your car in good condition , regardless of whether your top is constructed of cloth or vinyl .
Steps
Cleaning Convertible Tops
Wash your convertible regularly .
It is recommended that you clean your convertible top at least once every 4 weeks to keep dirt from sinking into the fabric or vinyl .
Wet the top of the convertible with a hose .
Use a gentle car shampoo or one made specifically for convertible tops , which can be found in any automotive or home improvement store .
Apply the cleaner with a sponge as you would to the rest of your vehicle .
Allow the cleaner to sit for 15 minutes for stubborn dirt or stains .
Scrub the top gently with a bristled brush
Rinse thoroughly with water. .
Protecting Cloth Tops
Begin with a top that is dry and free of dirt and debris .
Apply a fabric convertible-top protectant .
Spray the product directly onto the vehicle from a distance of approximately 16-18 inches .
Allow the top to dry completely .
Dry thoroughly with a clean , microfiber towel .
Protecting Vinyl Tops
Ensure your vinyl top is clean and dry .
Using sweeping motions , spray a vinyl convertible-top protectant at a distance of 8-12 inches from the top , or spray the product onto a clean , microfiber cloth and wipe the convertible top .
Wipe the top thoroughly with a fresh cloth until it 's completely dry .
Repeat this process up to three times if dirt or stains remain .
Tips
Avoid washing your convertible in direct sunlight .
Always wash your convertible top all at once rather than washing in spots , as this will cause certain areas of the top to be discolored .
If in doubt , determine whether your convertible top is vinyl or fabric by dropping 1/8 tsp . of water on the top and working it into the material .
If it begins to soak in , the convertible top is most likely made of cloth .
A vinyl top would allow the drop to pool up and remain .
A cloth top will also gather small particles such as lint more easily than vinyl will .
Warnings
Avoid washing your convertible top with common household cleaners such as bleach , which can cause the fabric or vinyl to deteriorate .
Things You 'll Need
Convertible-top cleaner
Vinyl convertible-top protectant
Fabric convertible-top protectant
Microfiber cleaning cloths
